job_description:
Executive Assistant & Office Manager

About Sword Health

Sword Health is a high-tech startup on a mission to free two billion people from pain. As a Forbes Best Startup Employer in 2025, we offer a stimulating, fast-paced environment with opportunities for creativity and career growth.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly organized and motivated Executive Assistant & Office Manager to support our leadership team and ensure the smooth operation of our Lisbon office.

Responsibilities

  • Manage calendars, travel arrangements, and communications for 3-4 leadership team members.
  • Oversee all aspects of the Lisbon office environment, including reception, shipping, mail, kitchen upkeep, and building maintenance.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for vendors, maintenance, and other office-related needs.
  • Greet clients and visitors, handle incoming and outgoing phone calls, and provide exceptional customer service.
  • Assist in organizing, scheduling, and executing onsite events.
  • Provide executive assistant support, including coordinating calendars, scheduling meetings, and arranging travel accommodations.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience as an Executive Assistant and/or Office Manager.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in both Portuguese and English.
  • Proficiency with office management and meeting scheduling software, including Google Calendar, Gmail, and Google Meets.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Salary range: €33,245 - €52,242 per year (base, variable, and equity).
  • Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance, meal allowance, equity shares, remote work allowance, flexible working hours, work from home options, discretionary vacation, snacks and beverages, and English classes.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

Executive Support:

  • Manage calendars, travel arrangements, and communications for 3-4 leadership team members.
  • Coordinate meetings, prepare agendas, and take minutes.
  • Draft and edit correspondence, presentations, and other documents.

Office Management:

  • Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Lisbon office, ensuring a smooth and efficient work environment.
  • Manage reception, including greeting visitors and answering phone calls.
  • Handle incoming and outgoing mail, shipping, and supply orders.
  • Coordinate building maintenance and repairs.
  • Maintain office equipment and supplies.

Event Coordination:

  • Assist in planning and executing onsite events, including scheduling, logistics, and vendor management.
about_company:
About Sword Health

Sword Health is a high-tech startup on a mission to revolutionize musculoskeletal (MSK) care and free two billion people from pain. As a Forbes Best Startup Employer, Sword Health fosters a stimulating, fast-paced environment where creativity and career growth thrive.

Backed by a $4 billion valuation, Sword Health leverages cutting-edge technology to deliver personalized, accessible, and effective MSK care. Their innovative platform combines AI-powered diagnostics, expert physical therapy, and engaging digital tools to empower individuals to take control of their health and achieve lasting pain relief.
selection_process:
Sword Health Executive Assistant & Office Manager Hiring Workflow

1. Application Review: AI-powered screening analyzes resumes and cover letters for relevant skills and experience.

2. Phone Screening: Short phone interviews conducted by HR to assess communication skills and basic qualifications.

3. Skills Assessment: Candidates complete a short online assessment testing proficiency in office software and organizational skills.

4. Interview Rounds:

  • First Interview: Meeting with the hiring manager to discuss experience, responsibilities, and company culture.
  • Second Interview: Panel interview with team members to evaluate teamwork and interpersonal skills.

    • 5. Reference Checks: Verification of candidate's previous employment and performance.

    6. Decision & Offer: The hiring team makes a final decision and extends a formal job offer to the selected candidate.

    This streamlined process ensures a fair and efficient evaluation of candidates, ultimately leading to the best fit for Sword Health's dynamic environment.

job_description:
Account Executive - Retail

About Quantum Metric

Quantum Metric is a leading digital experience analytics platform, recognized by Inc 5000 and Deloitte 500 for five consecutive years. As a remote-first company, we value diversity, inclusivity, and employee growth within a supportive and collaborative startup culture.

Job Description

We are seeking a driven and results-oriented Account Executive to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for driving enterprise growth within the retail sector by identifying, qualifying, and closing new accounts. You will develop strategic account plans, build a sustainable revenue pipeline, and manage complex sales cycles involving multiple stakeholders.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and qualify new retail accounts with high growth potential.
  • Conduct discovery sessions to understand customer needs and position Quantum Metric's SaaS solutions effectively.
  • Develop compelling business cases and demonstrate ROI to key stakeholders.
  • Manage intricate sales cycles, building strong relationships with C-level executives and other decision-makers.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless customer onboarding and ongoing support.
  • Exceed quarterly and annual sales quotas.

Qualifications:

  • Proven track record of exceeding sales quotas and closing complex deals within the retail industry.
  • Experience selling SaaS solutions with multiple stakeholders and long sales cycles.
  • Strong understanding of enterprise SaaS sales methodologies and best practices.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with C-level executives.
  • Strong business acumen and strategic thinking.

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Base salary: $130,000 - $155,000
  • OTE (On-Target Earnings) is double the base salary, with uncapped commissions.
  • Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision insurance, 401k, and unlimited paid time off.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Drive Revenue Growth: Identify, qualify, and close new retail accounts within assigned territory, exceeding quarterly and annual revenue targets.
  • Develop Strategic Account Plans: Create and execute tailored account plans for key retail prospects, outlining strategies to penetrate target accounts and build long-term relationships.
  • Solution Selling: Conduct in-depth discovery sessions to understand client needs and effectively position Quantum Metric's SaaS solutions as the optimal solution for their business challenges.
  • Manage Complex Sales Cycles: Navigate intricate sales processes involving multiple stakeholders across various levels within retail organizations, ensuring smooth transitions and timely closures.
  • Build Business Value: Collaborate with clients to develop compelling business cases that demonstrate the tangible ROI of Quantum Metric's solutions, highlighting key benefits and addressing specific pain points.
  • Relationship Management: Cultivate and nurture strong relationships with key decision-makers and influencers within retail accounts, fostering trust and driving ongoing engagement.
about_company:
About Quantum Metric

Quantum Metric is a leading digital experience intelligence platform, empowering businesses to understand and optimize their customer journeys in real-time. As a remote-first company, Quantum Metric fosters a diverse and inclusive culture that values employee growth and collaboration.

Recognized as a top performer by Inc. 5000 and Deloitte 500 for five consecutive years, Quantum Metric is driven by innovation and a commitment to delivering exceptional customer experiences. We believe in empowering our employees to make a real impact and contribute to our mission of helping businesses thrive in the digital age.
selection_process:
Quantum Metric Account Executive Retail Selection Process

Application Review: Qualified candidates will be reviewed based on their resume, cover letter, and LinkedIn profile, focusing on relevant experience, skills, and achievements.

Phone Screening: Shortlisted candidates will participate in a 30-minute phone interview with a recruiter to assess their communication skills, motivation, and alignment with Quantum Metric's values.

Technical Assessment: Candidates will complete a technical assessment evaluating their understanding of SaaS sales methodologies, product knowledge, and ability to analyze customer needs.

Virtual Interviews: Top performers will participate in two virtual interviews:

  • Behavioral Interview: Led by a hiring manager, this interview will assess the candidate's experience handling complex sales cycles, building relationships, and navigating stakeholder management.
  • Case Study Interview: Candidates will present a solution to a simulated business challenge, demonstrating their strategic thinking, problem-solving abilities, and presentation skills.

Final Decision: The hiring team will review all interview feedback and assessment results to make a final decision.

This comprehensive process ensures Quantum Metric selects the best-fit Account Executive Retail who can contribute to the company's continued growth and success.

qualification:
Qualifications

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Senior Product Designer to join our growing team.

Required:

  • 5-7 years of proven experience designing consumer-facing products for iOS, Android, and web platforms.
  • Exceptional design skills encompassing UX, visual design, and interaction, demonstrating a strong product sensibility.
  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with product managers, engineers, and other cross-functional teams.
  • Data-driven approach to design, utilizing research, metrics, and usability testing to inform design decisions.
  • Experience implementing inclusive design practices considering internationalization, accessibility, and multi-language support.
  • Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills with a collaborative and team-oriented mindset.

job_description:
Senior Product Designer

About AllTrails

AllTrails is a U.S.-based remote company with a physical office in the San Francisco Bay Area, dedicated to connecting people with the outdoors. We are passionate about helping people find and explore amazing trails.

About the Role

As a Senior Product Designer, you will play a key role in shaping the future of AllTrails. You will lead the design and development of best-in-class experiences across our web, iOS, and Android platforms, focusing on visual design, interaction, interface design, and prototyping.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the design and execution of end-to-end user experiences, conducting research, defining scope, and managing priorities.
  • Collaborate closely with product management, research, content, data, and engineering teams to deliver impactful product solutions.
  • Contribute to the design system and foster a collaborative and innovative design culture.
  • Utilize data-driven insights, research, and usability testing to inform design decisions and ensure user-centered design.
  • Champion inclusive design practices, considering internationalization, accessibility, and multi-language needs.

Qualifications

  • 5-7 years of proven experience designing consumer-facing iOS, Android, and web products.
  • Exceptional design skills across UX, visual design, and interaction, with a strong product sensibility.
  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product management and engineering.
  • Experience using data and research to inform design decisions and iterate on solutions.
  • Familiarity with inclusive design principles and practices.
  • Self-motivated, open-minded team player with a humble and empathetic working style.
  • Passion for the outdoors and helping people explore new trails.

Compensation

$157,500 - $177,500 per year, with a starting salary determined based on skills, experience, and credentials.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Lead Design Initiatives: Spearhead the design and development of innovative features and experiences for AllTrails' web, iOS, and Android platforms.
  • User-Centered Design: Conduct user research, analyze data, and leverage insights to inform design decisions, ensuring a user-centric approach.
  • Visual & Interaction Design: Craft compelling visual designs, intuitive interactions, and seamless user flows that enhance the overall user experience.
  • Collaboration & Communication: Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including product management, engineering, research, and content to ensure alignment and successful execution of design projects.
  • Design System & Best Practices: Contribute to the development and maintenance of AllTrails' design system, promoting consistency and scalability across all platforms.
  • Prototyping & Iteration: Create high-fidelity prototypes to test and iterate on design concepts, gathering feedback and refining designs based on user testing and data analysis.
about_company:
About AllTrails

AllTrails is a U.S.-based remote company with a physical office in the San Francisco Bay Area, dedicated to inspiring and empowering people to connect with nature through outdoor adventures. We are the world's largest trail database, offering millions of user-generated trail maps, photos, and reviews across the globe.

Our mission is to make it easier for everyone to discover and experience the joy of hiking, biking, running, and exploring the outdoors. We believe that access to nature is essential for well-being and strive to create a platform that is inclusive and accessible to all.

At AllTrails, we foster a collaborative and innovative environment where passionate individuals can make a real impact. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team that reflects the communities we serve.
selection_process:
AllTrails Senior Product Designer Hiring Workflow

1. Application Review: Candidates submit their resume and portfolio through the job portal. The AI Agent automatically screens applications based on keywords, skills, and experience matching the job description.

2. Initial Screening: Qualified candidates are invited for a 30-minute phone interview with a recruiter to discuss their experience, motivations, and alignment with AllTrails' culture.

3. Design Challenge: Shortlisted candidates complete a design challenge focused on a real-world AllTrails problem. This allows the team to assess their design thinking, problem-solving abilities, and technical skills.

4. Portfolio Review: The design team reviews the candidate's portfolio in detail, focusing on their past work, design process, and ability to create user-centered solutions.

5. Technical Interview: Candidates participate in a technical interview with a senior engineer to discuss their understanding of design systems, accessibility, and collaboration with development teams.

6. Final Round Interview: Top candidates meet with the hiring manager and other key stakeholders for a final interview to discuss their vision for the role, their contributions to the team, and their cultural fit within AllTrails.

7. Decision & Offer: The hiring team makes a final decision based on the candidate's performance throughout the process. A formal offer is extended to the selected candidate.

job_description:
Data Collection Participant: Photo Submission Task

Company: CrowdGen by Appen

Location: Remote

Pay Rate: $17.50 USD (one-time payment)

Project Overview:

CrowdGen by Appen is seeking individuals to contribute to the advancement of AI development by providing personal photo data. This project involves submitting 20 photos for use in training AI systems.

Responsibilities:

  • Submit a total of 20 personal photos, divided into two categories:
    • Type A: 10 photos taken within the past 2 years.
    • Type B: 10 photos taken more than 2 years ago.
  • Each photo must include the approximate date it was taken.
  • Adhere to all project guidelines and instructions.

Qualifications:

  • Fluent in Arabic.
  • Both male and female participants are welcome.

Benefits:

  • Contribute to cutting-edge AI research.
  • Simple, one-time task.
  • Flexible participation - submit photos from anywhere!

To Apply:

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply. If selected, you will receive an email from CrowdGen with instructions on creating an account and completing the application process.

This is a project-based opportunity with CrowdGen, where you will join the CrowdGen Community as an Independent Contractor.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Photo Submission: Provide 20 personal photographs as specified in the project guidelines.
  • Photo Categorization: Categorize submitted photos into two types: Type A (taken within the past 2 years) and Type B (taken more than 2 years ago).
  • Date Approximation: Accurately estimate the date each photo was taken and include it with the submission.
  • Quality Assurance: Ensure all submitted photos meet the project's quality standards and requirements.
  • Communication: Respond promptly to any communication from the project manager regarding photo submissions.
about_company:
About CrowdGen by Appen

CrowdGen by Appen is a global leader in providing high-quality data for the development of artificial intelligence (AI). We connect businesses with a diverse community of skilled individuals who contribute to training and improving AI systems.

Our platform empowers individuals to participate in meaningful projects, leveraging their unique perspectives and experiences to shape the future of technology. CrowdGen offers a wide range of project opportunities, from data annotation and transcription to image and video analysis, providing flexible and rewarding ways to contribute to cutting-edge AI research.

By joining the CrowdGen community, you become part of a global network of individuals who are passionate about advancing AI and its positive impact on the world.
selection_process:
CrowdGen Data Collection Participant Photo Submission Task: Hiring Workflow

1. Application: Interested candidates submit their applications through the job portal, providing basic information and confirming fluency in Arabic.

2. Initial Screening: The AI Agent automatically screens applications based on language proficiency and eligibility criteria.

3. Project Introduction: Shortlisted candidates receive an email outlining the project details, including the task description, requirements, and compensation.

4. Account Creation: Candidates create an account on the CrowdGen platform using the provided email address and complete the setup process.

5. Task Agreement: Candidates review and accept the project agreement, acknowledging the terms and conditions.

6. Photo Submission: Candidates submit 20 photos according to the specified types and requirements.

7. Quality Review: The AI Agent and/or project manager review submitted photos for adherence to guidelines.

8. Payment: Upon successful completion and approval of photo submissions, participants are paid the agreed-upon rate.

This streamlined workflow ensures efficient candidate selection and project execution.

job_description:
FP&A Analyst - Aprio PH

About Aprio:

Aprio is a nationally ranked CPA and advisory firm with 30 U.S. office locations and over 2,100 team members worldwide. We are dedicated to providing exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients.

Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical FP&A Analyst to join our growing team in the Philippines. In this role, you will play a key part in supporting the financial planning and analysis activities for incoming M&A firms, providing critical insights to Practice Group Leadership, and driving process improvements within the FP&A function.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist in budgeting and forecasting for incoming M&A firms.
  • Update financial insights and reports for Practice Group Leadership.
  • Maintain working models to forecast revenue and personnel staffing needs.
  • Drive process improvements and enhance efficiency in the FP&A function.
  • Assist in reviewing and testing the accuracy of financial dashboards.
  • Complete ad-hoc projects and provide meaningful analyses to senior management and departmental leads.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of financial planning and analysis experience.
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Microsoft Power BI and Workday Adaptive Planning is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and prioritize competing demands.

Aprio offers a competitive compensation package, performance-based salary increases, discretionary incentive compensation, and a comprehensive benefits program.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Financial Modeling & Analysis: Develop and maintain financial models to forecast revenue, expenses, and personnel staffing needs for incoming M&A firms.
  • Budgeting & Forecasting: Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and quarterly forecasts for M&A integration.
  • Reporting & Insights: Generate insightful financial reports and presentations for Practice Group Leadership, highlighting key performance indicators and trends.
  • Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and enhance the efficiency of FP&A processes and implement solutions.
  • Data Analysis & Visualization: Review and test the accuracy of financial dashboards, leveraging data visualization tools to communicate financial information effectively.
  • Ad-hoc Support: Complete ad-hoc projects and provide data-driven analyses to support senior management and departmental leads.
about_company:
About Aprio

Aprio is a nationally ranked CPA and advisory firm dedicated to providing exceptional service and innovative solutions to businesses of all sizes. With over 2,100 team members across 30 U.S. office locations, Aprio combines deep industry expertise with a collaborative, client-centric approach.

Aprio's commitment to excellence extends beyond traditional accounting services. They offer a comprehensive suite of advisory solutions, including financial planning & analysis, mergers & acquisitions, technology consulting, and more. Driven by a passion for helping clients achieve their goals, Aprio fosters a culture of continuous learning and professional development, empowering their team to deliver cutting-edge insights and strategies.
selection_process:
Aprio PH FP&A Analyst Hiring Workflow

1. Application Review: AI-powered screening evaluates resumes against required skills and experience.

2. Initial Screening: Qualified candidates are contacted for a brief phone interview to assess communication skills and basic qualifications.

3. Skills Assessment: Candidates shortlisted from the phone interview complete a technical assessment testing Excel proficiency and financial modeling skills.

4. Virtual Interview: Top performers participate in a virtual interview with the hiring manager and/or team members, focusing on experience, problem-solving abilities, and cultural fit.

5. Final Interview: Selected candidates undergo a final interview, potentially including a case study or presentation, to evaluate their analytical and presentation skills.

6. Reference Checks: Background and reference checks are conducted for finalists.

7. Offer & Onboarding: The chosen candidate receives a formal offer and begins the onboarding process.

job_description:
Sales Development Representative

About Heard

Heard is dedicated to connecting mental health professionals with resources to grow their practices. We're a mission-driven company seeking a passionate Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing team.

What You'll Do

As an SDR, you'll be the first point of contact for prospective customers, primarily therapists and wellness professionals. Your responsibilities include:

  • Conducting high-volume outreach via phone, text, and email.
  • Qualifying leads, gathering information, and identifying potential fit for Heard's platform.
  • Booking and confirming consultation meetings, ensuring prospects are well-prepared.
  • Maintaining accurate records in HubSpot CRM and ensuring a clean sales pipeline.
  • Proactively following up with prospects within tight timelines.
  • Collaborating with Account Executives and other team members to ensure a seamless lead handover.
  • Consistently achieving or exceeding activity and booking targets.

What Success Looks Like

  • 90+ high-quality touches daily (calls, texts, emails).
  • Consistently high consult booking and show rates.
  • Accurate and detailed lead qualification and data entry.
  • A willingness to experiment with new approaches and embrace feedback.

You'll Excel If You...

  • Have 1+ year of experience as a BDR, SDR, or in a similar outbound/sales role (healthtech or SaaS preferred, but not required).
  • Thrive in a high-energy environment with targets and a focus on making a real difference.
  • Are proactive, organized, resourceful, and a reliable team player.
  • Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Learn new systems quickly (HubSpot, SalesMsg, and other modern tools).

Why Heard

  • Make a real impact in the mental health field.
  • Join a supportive team environment that values learning and growth.
  • Benefit from clear targets and transparent compensation tied to your performance.
  • Explore career growth opportunities as we expand.

Compensation

  • Base: $30,000
  • OTE: $60,000
  • Commission: 50/50
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Prospect Outreach: Conduct high-volume outreach via phone, email, and text to qualified leads within the mental health and wellness space.
  • Lead Qualification: Assess lead fit for Heard's platform, gather relevant information, and determine their potential for conversion.
  • Appointment Setting: Schedule and confirm consultation meetings with prospects, ensuring they are prepared for a valuable discussion.
  • CRM Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records within HubSpot CRM, ensuring a clean and organized sales pipeline.
  • Pipeline Management: Proactively follow up with prospects within strict timeframes (first outreach within 1-2 hours of lead receipt) to maximize engagement.
  • Team Collaboration: Partner closely with Account Executives and other team members to seamlessly hand off qualified leads and contribute to overall team success.
  • Performance Driven: Consistently achieve or exceed activity and booking targets, contributing to the achievement of monthly and quarterly goals.
  • Continuous Improvement: Actively contribute insights and ideas to the team, demonstrating a commitment to process optimization and growth.
about_company:
About Heard

Heard is a mission-driven company dedicated to empowering mental health professionals to build thriving practices. We connect therapists, counselors, and wellness practitioners with the resources they need to grow their businesses and reach more people in need.

Our innovative platform provides a comprehensive suite of tools and services, streamlining administrative tasks, facilitating client management, and offering valuable marketing and business development support. At Heard, we believe that access to quality mental healthcare is essential, and we're passionate about supporting the professionals who make it possible.
selection_process:
Heard's Hiring Workflow for Sales Development Representatives

1. Application Review: Candidates submit their resumes and cover letters through the job portal. The AI-powered system screens applications based on keywords, experience, and qualifications.

2. Phone Screening: Shortlisted candidates participate in a brief phone interview with a recruiter to assess their communication skills, enthusiasm, and basic understanding of the role.

3. Skills Assessment: Qualified candidates complete a short online assessment focusing on sales aptitude, communication, and problem-solving skills.

4. Interview with Sales Manager: Top performers are invited for a virtual interview with the Sales Manager to discuss their experience, sales strategies, and alignment with Heard's mission.

5. Team Interview: Finalists participate in a group interview with the SDR team to assess their collaborative skills, personality fit, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

6. Offer & Onboarding: Successful candidates receive a formal offer and embark on a comprehensive onboarding program designed to integrate them into the Heard team and equip them for success.

job_description:
Underwriter

About Gravie

Gravie is a healthcare company revolutionizing the way people access and purchase healthcare through innovative, consumer-centric health benefit solutions. We are a well-capitalized company with a unique culture that values non-hierarchical, merit-driven, and opinionated individuals who thrive in a high-performance environment.

Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Underwriter to join our growing team. In this role, you will independently underwrite new business and renewals, utilizing Gravie's proprietary underwriting engine. You will assess group-level risk, generate competitive pricing proposals, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive underwriting best practices and refine plan designs.

Responsibilities

  • Independently underwrite new business and renewals using Gravie's proprietary underwriting engine.
  • Analyze group-level risk, claims experience, demographic data, and utilization trends to generate competitive pricing proposals.
  • Collaborate with Sales, Account Management, and Product teams to implement underwriting best practices and refine plan designs.
  • Communicate rates and plan details to Sales and Account Management teams.

Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of underwriting experience, including 1-2 years with stop loss and/or level-funded health plans.
  • Proven ability to independently underwrite standard and moderately complex cases.
  • Strong analytical and technical skills with a keen eye for detail.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to confidently interact with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively with minimal supervision.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Salary range: $58,600 - $97,600 annually.
  • Comprehensive benefits package including alternative medicine coverage, flexible PTO, paid parental leave, paid holidays, 401k program, cell phone reimbursement, transportation perks, education reimbursement, and 1 week of paid paw-ternity leave.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Underwrite New Business and Renewals: Independently assess and underwrite new group health plan applications and renewals using Gravie's proprietary underwriting engine.
  • Analyze Risk and Price Plans: Evaluate group-level risk factors, including claims experience, demographic data, and utilization trends, to generate competitive pricing proposals.
  • Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with Sales, Account Management, and Product teams to implement best underwriting practices and refine plan designs.
  • Communicate Pricing and Plans: Effectively communicate quoted rates and plan details to Sales and Account Management teams, ensuring clear understanding and alignment.
  • Maintain Underwriting Standards: Adhere to established underwriting guidelines and regulations, ensuring accuracy and compliance in all underwriting activities.
about_company:
About Gravie

Gravie is revolutionizing the healthcare landscape by providing innovative, consumer-centric health benefit solutions. We empower individuals and businesses to make smarter choices about their healthcare through transparent, flexible, and affordable plans.

Driven by a unique culture that values meritocracy, collaboration, and bold ideas, Gravie fosters an environment where passionate individuals can thrive. We are a well-capitalized company committed to making a real difference in the lives of our members and employees.

At Gravie, we believe in building a better future for healthcare, and we're looking for talented individuals to join us on this journey.
selection_process:
Gravie Underwriter Hiring Workflow

1. Application Review: AI-powered screening analyzes resumes for required skills and experience.

job_description:
Senior AI Python Developer at Koombea

About Koombea:

Koombea is a leading international app development company with a proven track record of building successful applications. Founded in 2007, Koombea has a portfolio of hundreds of apps, some of which have been acquired by industry giants like Google and Facebook.

Job Description:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior AI Python Developer to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining backend services and APIs using Python and frameworks like Flask and FastAPI. You will also play a key role in building and deploying ETL pipelines for data migration and transformation, leveraging your expertise in AWS services such as Lambda, S3, RDS, EC2, API Gateway, and VPC.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable and secure RESTful APIs using Python and relevant frameworks.
  • Build and deploy ETL pipelines for data migration and transformation, focusing on RDS to S3 data movement.
  • Collaborate with the team to develop and implement AI/ML solutions using tools and services like Cursor, AWS Bedrock, and SageMaker.
  • Participate in architecture discussions and contribute to DevOps, SOA, and microservices designs.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML and cloud technologies.

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience developing backend services using Python.
  • Strong understanding of AWS services, including DevOps, ETL, and architecture.
  • Proven experience with Lambda, S3, RDS, EC2, AWS Glue, and VPC.
  • Expertise in building and deploying ETL pipelines, particularly RDS to S3.
  • Proficiency with API Gateway and RESTful service design.
  • Experience with AI/ML and Data Science tools, ideally AWS SageMaker or similar.
  • Familiarity with AI platforms like Cursor and AWS Bedrock.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Fluent English (C1)

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working schedule
  • Remote work opportunities
  • Performance bonuses
  • Surprise goodies and many cool benefits.

  • Design and Develop AI Solutions: Conceptualize, design, and develop innovative AI-powered solutions leveraging machine learning algorithms and frameworks.
  • Python Backend Development: Build robust and scalable backend services and APIs using Python and frameworks like Flask and FastAPI.
  • Data Engineering: Design, implement, and maintain ETL pipelines for data ingestion, transformation, and loading into various data stores.
  • Cloud Infrastructure Expertise: Utilize AWS services (Lambda, S3, RDS, EC2, API Gateway, VPC) to deploy, manage, and scale AI applications.
  • AI Platform Integration: Integrate with AI platforms like Cursor and AWS Bedrock to leverage pre-trained models and accelerate development.
  • Collaboration and Communication: Work effectively within a team of developers, data scientists, and product managers to deliver high-quality AI solutions.

Senior Software Engineer

About Proof

Proof is a leading digital identity-assured transaction management platform, founded in 2015 with a mission to digitize trust for all of life's most critical transactions. We foster a collaborative environment focused on mentorship, continuous deployment, and building innovative solutions.

Responsibilities

As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining features for Proof's customers and users.

  • Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to deliver high-quality features.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-tested code in Ruby on Rails and React.
  • Troubleshoot complex technical issues in production environments.
  • Drive improvements in code quality and best practices through code reviews and mentoring.
  • Participate in an on-call rotation to ensure system stability.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience building complex, performant, customer-facing enterprise applications using Ruby on Rails and React.
  • Strong understanding of software development principles and best practices.
  • Proven ability to write unit and integration tests.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies.

Compensation

We offer a competitive salary range of $150,000 - $190,000 per year, along with a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, and equity.

Egen is a rapidly growing data-first company leveraging advanced technology platforms to drive impactful decisions through data and insights.

Job Description:

We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Scientist to join our team and contribute to the development of cutting-edge foundation models. You will play a key role in building, optimizing, and evaluating large multimodal models across various data modalities.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and optimize large multimodal models.
  • Collaborate with engineering and research teams to establish evaluation pipelines and enhance task-specific model performance.

  • Proven experience in neural network model development, including building or fine-tuning large models.
  • Expertise in model performance profiling and optimization.
  • Experience with developing scalable ML evaluation pipelines.
  • Familiarity with multimodal model training and data pipeline development.

  • Model Training & Deployment: Implement efficient training, profiling, inference, and fine-tuning strategies for foundation models using cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

job_description:
Exchange Operations Analyst

Coins.ph

About Coins.ph

Coins.ph is a leading cryptocurrency brand in the Philippines, serving over 18 million users. Fully regulated by the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP), Coins.ph holds Virtual Currency and Electronic Money Issuer licenses, making it the first crypto-based company in Asia to achieve this distinction.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Exchange Operations Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our cryptocurrency exchange platform.

Responsibilities:

  • Configure and test the exchange application end-to-end.
  • Monitor exchange prices and spreads to ensure alignment with global market prices.
  • Manage treasury for the quant wallet and maintain exchange liquidity.
  • Prepare and present weekly OKR reports.
  • Onboard partners onto the exchange and identify inefficiencies to increase profitability.
  • Troubleshoot live-trading issues.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in crypto operations and process optimization.
  • Experience in spot or conversion trading, risk management, and automation tools.
  • Excellent communication and project management skills.

Benefits:

Coins.ph offers a dynamic and challenging work environment with opportunities for career advancement.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Exchange Application Management: Configure, test, and maintain the functionality of the exchange application, ensuring seamless user experience and operational efficiency.
  • Market Monitoring & Liquidity Management: Continuously monitor exchange prices and spreads, comparing them to global market benchmarks. Manage the quant wallet treasury and implement strategies to optimize exchange liquidity.
  • Performance Reporting & Analysis: Prepare and present comprehensive weekly reports outlining key performance indicators (KPIs) and operational objectives and results (OKRs). Analyze data to identify trends and areas for improvement.
  • Partner Onboarding & Optimization: Onboard new partners onto the exchange platform, ensuring a smooth integration process. Identify inefficiencies in existing partner relationships and implement strategies to enhance profitability.
  • Issue Resolution & Support: Proactively troubleshoot live-trading issues, providing timely and effective solutions to minimize disruptions and ensure a stable trading environment.
about_company:
About Coins.ph

Coins.ph is the Philippines' leading cryptocurrency brand, empowering over 18 million users to access the future of finance. Fully regulated by the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP), Coins.ph holds the prestigious distinction of being the first crypto-based company in Asia to receive both Virtual Currency and Electronic Money Issuer licenses.

Driven by a mission to make crypto accessible and user-friendly, Coins.ph offers a secure and intuitive platform for buying, selling, and trading digital assets. As a fast-growing organization, Coins.ph fosters a dynamic and innovative environment, providing ample opportunities for career development and making a real impact in the evolving world of finance.

job_description:

City Electric Supply (CES), a leading family-owned electrical wholesaler with over 65 years of experience and 7,400 employees worldwide, is seeking a detail-oriented and passionate QA Analyst to join our growing team.

  • Hands-on experience with test automation tools.
  • Familiarity with Agile or Scrum software development methodologies.
  • Exposure to AI-enhanced testing practices is a plus.

Compensation: $68,000 - $110,000 per year.

Physical Demands: This position requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, and climbing, with the ability to lift and move items up to 50 pounds.
key_responsibility:

  • Develop and Execute Test Strategies: Design comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts to ensure thorough coverage of software functionality across various platforms and devices.

  • Identify and Document Defects: Meticulously analyze test results, identify software defects, and document them accurately using defect tracking tools.
  • Automate Testing Processes: Contribute to the development and maintenance of automated testing frameworks and scripts to enhance testing efficiency and reduce manual effort.

About Prompt:

Prompt is a rapidly growing healthcare technology company revolutionizing the industry with modern B2B enterprise software. We offer a competitive salary, remote/hybrid work environment, and potential equity compensation for outstanding performance. Job Summary:

Responsibilities:

  • Build, maintain, and scale containerized applications with Docker and ECS/Fargate.
  • Ensure system scalability, availability, and reliability through proactive monitoring and automation.
  • Troubleshoot issues in production and development environments.
  • Collaborate with development teams to enhance performance, security, and maintainability.

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in a DevOps or related role.
  • Expert knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
  • Strong experience with containerization technologies (Docker, ECS / Kubernetes).
  • Experience with CI/CD pipeline design and management.

job_description:
Senior Security Engineer

About Loft Orbital

Loft Orbital is revolutionizing access to space by building "shareable" satellites. We provide a fast and simple path to orbit for organizations requiring space-based capabilities. Loft Orbital operates satellites, flies customer payloads, and manages entire missions from end to end. We are a diverse and community-driven company committed to hiring the best talent regardless of background.

Job Description

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Senior Security Engineer to join our growing team. You will play a critical role in ensuring the security of our cloud-native infrastructure, applications, and data.

Responsibilities:

  • Champion DevSecOps best practices by integrating security controls into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Lead and automate application and infrastructure security assessments, including threat modeling and code reviews.
  • Collaborate with developers and SREs to identify, remediate, and prevent vulnerabilities through secure design and practical guidance.
  • Design, build, and maintain secure architecture patterns for containerized, cloud-native, and distributed workloads.
  • Develop and maintain automated security tooling, such as container image scanning, IaC validation, and policy-as-code.

Qualifications:

  • Deep experience with cloud security in AWS, Azure, or GCP environments.
  • Strong knowledge of container and Kubernetes security in production environments.
  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language (e.g., Python, Go, C++).
  • Hands-on experience with zero-trust architecture, service mesh, and software-defined networking.
  • Solid understanding of DevSecOps pipelines, IaC tools, and secure build processes.

Compensation:

$140,250 - $190,000 per year, determined by education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Secure Development Lifecycle: Champion DevSecOps principles by integrating security controls into the CI/CD pipeline.
  • Vulnerability Management: Lead and automate application and infrastructure security assessments, including threat modeling and code reviews. Collaborate with development and operations teams to identify, remediate, and prevent vulnerabilities.
  • Secure Architecture: Design, build, and maintain secure architecture patterns for containerized, cloud-native, and distributed workloads.
  • Automation & Tooling: Develop and maintain automated security tooling, such as container image scanning, infrastructure-as-code (IaC) validation, and policy-as-code.
  • Incident Response: Participate in incident response activities, analyzing security events and implementing mitigation strategies.
  • Compliance & Standards: Ensure adherence to relevant security standards and regulations.

Manufacturing Expert - AI Trainer

About RYZ Labs

RYZ Labs is a startup studio founded in 2021, dedicated to building industry-defining companies leveraging cutting-edge technologies. We operate as a remote and distributed team across the US and Latin America.

Job Description

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Manufacturing Expert to join our team as an AI Trainer. In this role, you will collaborate with clients to develop AI models for intelligent systems within manufacturing environments. Your deep understanding of industrial processes and technologies will be instrumental in shaping these models and contributing to the development of next-generation intelligent systems.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with clients to define AI model requirements and objectives for manufacturing applications.
  • Leverage your expertise in manufacturing processes, tools, and methodologies to guide the development and training of AI models.
  • Analyze manufacturing data and identify patterns and insights to inform model development and optimization.
  • Contribute to the creation of documentation and training materials for AI-powered manufacturing solutions.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial Engineering, or a related field from a top U.S. university.
  • 5+ years of experience in manufacturing, encompassing areas such as production, operations, quality, or process engineering.
  • Strong understanding of manufacturing tools, methodologies, and standards (ERP, MES, PLM, ISO).
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Data Annotation & Labeling: Annotate and label manufacturing data (images, sensor readings, process logs) to train AI models.
  • Model Training & Evaluation: Collaborate with AI engineers to train and evaluate AI models for specific manufacturing tasks (e.g., defect detection, predictive maintenance).
  • Process Understanding & Documentation: Deeply understand manufacturing processes and document them in a way that is understandable to AI models.
  • Feedback & Iteration: Provide feedback on AI model performance and work with the team to iterate on model training and improvement.
  • Knowledge Transfer: Share manufacturing expertise with the AI team to ensure AI models are aligned with real-world manufacturing challenges and best practices.

job_description:
Primary Coach, Career Prep

About Management Leadership for Tomorrow (MLT)

Management Leadership for Tomorrow (MLT) is a national nonprofit dedicated to expanding economic opportunities and building a more inclusive economy. We empower enterprising young people with a proven playbook for economic mobility and partner with leading employers to recruit diverse talent.

Job Summary

As a Primary Coach, you will play a vital role in guiding a portfolio of undergraduate Fellows through MLT's Career Prep curriculum. You will provide personalized coaching, facilitate engaging workshops, and support Fellows in achieving their career goals.

Responsibilities

  • Coach Fellows through MLT's Career Prep curriculum, providing guidance on resume development, interview preparation, and internship/job selection strategies.
  • Track and manage Fellow progress, outcomes, and qualitative insights.
  • Design and facilitate engaging content for virtual and in-person seminars and webinars.
  • Provide targeted advising to Fellows, addressing individual needs and challenges.
  • Monitor Fellow engagement and proactively intervene when necessary to ensure they stay on track.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree required; Master's degree preferred.
  • 5+ years of professional experience in Consulting with a proven record of success.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the bar for success in top private-sector organizations.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills (both written and oral).
  • Proven ability to build meaningful relationships and foster a supportive coaching environment.
  • Experience tracking and reporting data; experience using Salesforce is a plus.
  • Passion for coaching college students and/or professionals.

Benefits

This is a part-time opportunity with remote work arrangements. Benefits include access to LinkedIn Learning, Harvard Business Review, MLT-hosted sessions, team retreats, employee recognition, and Employee Affinity Groups. Paid time off, holidays, and wellness sessions are also provided.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Fellow Coaching & Development: Provide individualized coaching and guidance to a designated cohort of undergraduate Fellows throughout MLT's Career Prep curriculum. This includes facilitating workshops, providing feedback on resumes and cover letters, and offering personalized advice on internship and job search strategies.
  • Progress Monitoring & Reporting: Track and analyze Fellow progress, identifying areas of strength and areas requiring additional support. Maintain accurate records of Fellow outcomes and provide regular reports to MLT leadership.
  • Curriculum Enhancement: Contribute to the development and refinement of MLT's Career Prep curriculum by providing insights from coaching sessions and identifying emerging trends in the job market.
  • Community Building: Foster a supportive and collaborative learning environment for Fellows through virtual and in-person events, group discussions, and peer mentorship opportunities.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate effectively with MLT program staff, partner organizations, and employer representatives to ensure a seamless and impactful experience for Fellows.
about_company:
About Management Leadership for Tomorrow (MLT)

Management Leadership for Tomorrow (MLT) is a national non-profit organization dedicated to dismantling economic barriers and fostering a more inclusive economy. We empower enterprising young people from diverse backgrounds to achieve their full potential by providing them with a proven roadmap for economic mobility.

MLT partners with leading employers to connect them with top talent from all walks of life, ensuring a more equitable and representative workforce. Through our comprehensive programs, we equip Fellows with the skills, knowledge, and network necessary to thrive in demanding careers and become future leaders. We believe that everyone deserves the opportunity to succeed, and we are committed to creating a world where economic mobility is a reality for all.

job_description:
Backend Developer @ lobstr.io (Python Scraping, Celery)

About lobstr.io

lobstr.io is a no-code scraping SaaS used by 25,000+ active users monthly. We empower non-technical users to extract and automate structured data from complex websites.

We're looking for a full-time Backend Developer to join our core team and help us build, maintain, and scale our scraping infrastructure.

Your Mission

  • Build and maintain Python scrapers
  • Maintain and scale our asynchronous job pipeline (Celery + Redis)
  • Improve internal tools and admin panels
  • Solve scraping challenges: detection evasion, speed, modularity

Our Stack

  • Python, Django, PostgreSQL
  • Celery / Redis
  • GitLab, Notion, Trello, Slack
  • Remote Linux servers, VSCode, Sentry

Why Join Us

  • 150% YoY growth
  • Public scraper roadmap (goal: +4/month)
  • Profit-sharing on monthly MRR growth
  • Real impact on architecture and product
  • Full remote with paid time off (1 day/month)

Our Work Culture

  • 1 short dev sync per week
  • 1 monthly all-hands
  • You manage your schedule - we care about delivery, not hours

Trial & Salary

  • 3-month trial: $2,000/month
  • Then: $2,500/month + MRR growth sharing (20%)
  • Contract: freelance / contractor via Deel
  • Possible long-term contract or CTO-track if the fit is right

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience building and maintaining Python web applications
  • Strong understanding of asynchronous programming concepts (Celery, Redis)
  • Experience with web scraping techniques and challenges
  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a remote team
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

Scraping Infrastructure:

  • Design, develop, and maintain Python-based web scrapers for diverse websites.
  • Implement robust error handling and exception management strategies.
  • Optimize scraper performance for speed and efficiency.
  • Develop and maintain tools for detecting and evading anti-scraping measures.

Asynchronous Job Processing:

  • Manage and scale our asynchronous job pipeline using Celery and Redis.
  • Monitor job queue performance and implement optimizations for throughput.
  • Develop and maintain robust logging and monitoring systems for the job pipeline.

Internal Tools & Development:

  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of internal tools and admin panels.
  • Collaborate with the product team to implement new features and functionalities.
  • Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code.
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to the overall code quality.
about_company:
About lobstr.io

lobstr.io is a no-code web scraping SaaS empowering over 25,000 active users monthly to extract and automate structured data from complex websites. We believe everyone should have access to the power of data, regardless of their technical expertise.

Our mission is to democratize web scraping by providing a user-friendly platform that simplifies the process and unlocks valuable insights. We're a remote-first, async-friendly team with a low-meeting culture, focused on delivering impactful results. We're passionate about building innovative solutions and fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive.
selection_process:
lobstr.io Backend Developer Selection Process

lobstr.io is seeking a talented Backend Developer to join our remote-first team. Here's how our selection process works:

  1. Application Review: We'll carefully review your resume and cover letter, focusing on your Python, Django, and Celery experience, as well as your understanding of scraping techniques and asynchronous job processing.

  2. Technical Assessment: You'll be presented with a coding challenge designed to assess your skills in Python, web development, and scraping. This will be a practical exercise simulating real-world tasks.

  3. Interview Rounds: Successful candidates will participate in two rounds of interviews:

    • Initial Interview: A conversation with a team member to discuss your experience, motivations, and fit within our culture.
    • Technical Interview: A deeper dive into your technical skills and problem-solving abilities, focusing on your understanding of the job requirements and your approach to tackling challenges.

  4. Trial Period: If you impress us, you'll enter a 3-month trial period as a contractor. This allows us to evaluate your performance and collaboration style in a real-world setting.

  5. Onboarding: Upon successful completion of the trial, we'll offer you a full-time contract with a competitive salary and profit-sharing opportunities.

We're excited to meet talented developers who are passionate about building innovative solutions!

Qualifications

Required:

  • Proven experience auditing complex smart contracts with a deep understanding of Solidity, EVM behavior, and common vulnerability classes (e.g., reentrancy, logic flaws, gas griefing, access control).
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to model systems end-to-end and identify attack surfaces across DeFi primitives, tokenomics, governance, MEV, bridges, and ZK systems.

  • Experience with Ethereum security tooling (Foundry, Echidna, Slither, etc.).
  • Experience writing or reviewing technical specifications or protocol documentation.

Bonus:

  • Prior experience in formal audits with reputable firms (e.g., Spearbit, Zellic, Trail of Bits).
  • Familiarity with the Cantina Platform.
  • Lead reviewer experience or ability to manage a team of researchers.
  • Contributions to open-source security tooling.
  • Security publications, conference talks, or technical blog posts.
job_description:
Security Researcher at Spearbit

About the Role

Spearbit is seeking a talented and experienced Security Researcher to join our growing team. You will play a critical role in ensuring the security of cutting-edge blockchain protocols and smart contracts.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct in-depth security reviews of smart contracts, protocols, and blockchain infrastructure.
  • Analyze protocol designs and identify potential vulnerabilities across DeFi primitives, tokenomics, governance, MEV, bridges, and ZK systems.
  • Collaborate with other researchers and protocol developers to provide actionable recommendations and mitigate risks.
  • Reproduce exploits, write proof-of-concepts (POCs), and contribute patches when necessary.
  • Publish post-mortems, technical articles, and internal reports to share knowledge and contribute to the security community.

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience auditing complex smart contracts and a deep understanding of Solidity, EVM behavior, and common vulnerability classes.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for identifying and mitigating security risks.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to clearly articulate technical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • A track record of contributing to open-source projects, publishing security research, or participating in bug bounty programs.
  • Alignment with Spearbit's values of decentralization, cryptographic innovation, and building resilient systems.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with cross-chain protocols, bridging, rollups, or ZK systems.
  • Familiarity with Ethereum security tooling (Foundry, Echidna, Slither, etc.).
  • Experience writing or reviewing technical specifications or protocol documentation.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive compensation and benefits package.
  • Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and collaborate with leading researchers in the industry.
  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment that values innovation and knowledge sharing.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct in-depth security reviews: Analyze smart contracts, protocols, and blockchain infrastructure for vulnerabilities.
  • Identify attack surfaces: Evaluate protocol designs across DeFi primitives, tokenomics, governance, MEV, bridges, and ZK systems to pinpoint potential weaknesses.
  • Provide actionable recommendations: Deliver clear, concise reports outlining vulnerabilities and their potential impact, including technical and business implications.
  • Reproduce and demonstrate exploits: Demonstrate identified vulnerabilities through proof-of-concept (POC) development and, when applicable, contribute patches.
  • Contribute to knowledge sharing: Publish post-mortems, technical articles, and internal reports to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
  • Collaborate effectively: Work seamlessly within a pod or curated team with other senior researchers and protocol developers.
about_company:
About Spearbit

Spearbit is a leading security research firm specializing in the blockchain and decentralized finance (DeFi) space. We are dedicated to building a more secure and resilient web3 ecosystem by identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities in smart contracts, protocols, and blockchain infrastructure.

Our team of experienced security researchers combines deep technical expertise with a passion for innovation. We leverage cutting-edge tools and methodologies to conduct rigorous security audits, penetration testing, and vulnerability assessments. Spearbit's commitment to knowledge sharing is reflected in our active participation in the open-source community and our publication of technical research and insights.

We believe in empowering developers and projects to build secure and trustworthy decentralized applications. By partnering with Spearbit, you gain access to a team of experts who are dedicated to helping you navigate the complexities of blockchain security.

3. Portfolio Review: Candidates submit a portfolio showcasing their previous security research, bug bounties, audits, or open-source contributions.

4. Interview Rounds:

  • Technical Interview: A deep dive into technical skills and problem-solving abilities with a senior security researcher.
  • Culture Fit Interview: An interview with a team member to assess collaboration style and alignment with Spearbit's values.

5. Final Decision: The hiring team reviews all assessment results and interview feedback to select the most qualified candidate.

This streamlined process ensures a thorough evaluation of technical expertise, experience, and cultural fit, ultimately identifying the best Security Researcher for Spearbit.

job_description:
Customer Onboarding & Support Specialist - Gymflow

About Gymflow:

Gymflow is a fully remote SaaS platform empowering modern gym and fitness studio owners to streamline operations and accelerate growth. We are a passionate team of 9 individuals spread across Europe, dedicated to revolutionizing the fitness industry.

About the Role:

We are seeking a Customer Onboarding & Support Specialist to join our growing team. In this role, you will be the first point of contact for new clients, guiding them through the onboarding process and ensuring a seamless transition to Gymflow. You will also be responsible for providing ongoing customer support, troubleshooting issues, and contributing to our knowledge base.

Responsibilities:

  • Client Onboarding & Training (40%): Lead new clients through the signup process, configure their accounts, and provide comprehensive training on Gymflow's features and functionalities.
  • Customer Support (30%): Respond to customer inquiries via email and chat, troubleshoot technical issues, and escalate complex problems to the appropriate team.
  • Support Documentation (15%): Create clear and concise articles, screenshots, and video tutorials to assist customers in using Gymflow effectively.
  • Product Demos (10%): Conduct live product demonstrations for prospective customers, showcasing Gymflow's capabilities and benefits.
  • Voice of the Customer (5%): Gather customer feedback and identify recurring issues or trends to share with the engineering and product teams.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of experience in SaaS onboarding, support, or customer success.
  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Proven ability to lead screen-share trainings or live product walkthroughs.
  • Strong technical comprehension and troubleshooting skills.
  • Process-oriented mindset with a focus on documentation and improvement.

Compensation:

  • CAD $60,000 - $85,000 per year, depending on experience.
  • Full-time employee or long-term contractor (preferred).
  • Remote work across Canada in Eastern or Central Time zones.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

Client Onboarding (40%):

  • Guide new clients through the Gymflow platform, ensuring a smooth transition from signup to their first successful booking or payment.
  • Conduct personalized onboarding sessions, explaining key features and functionalities.
  • Develop and maintain onboarding materials, including tutorials and FAQs.

Customer Support (30%):

  • Respond to customer inquiries via email, chat, and phone, providing timely and effective solutions.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues and escalate complex problems to the appropriate team.
  • Maintain a comprehensive knowledge base of Gymflow features and functionalities.

Documentation & Training (15%):

  • Create and update user-friendly documentation, including articles, screenshots, and video tutorials.
  • Develop and deliver training materials for internal and external audiences.
  • Continuously improve support documentation based on customer feedback and usage data.

Product Demos (10%):

  • Conduct live product demonstrations for prospective customers, highlighting Gymflow's key benefits and features.
  • Tailor demos to specific customer needs and pain points.
  • Follow up with potential clients after demos to answer questions and address concerns.

Customer Feedback (5%):

  • Collect and analyze customer feedback, identifying trends and areas for improvement.
  • Share insights with the engineering and product teams to inform product development and enhance the customer experience.

4. Live Demo & Training: Candidates conduct a live product demo showcasing their ability to explain Gymflow's features and functionalities. They also participate in a simulated onboarding session, demonstrating their training and guidance skills.

5. Final Interview: Finalists engage in a live interview with the hiring manager, discussing their experience, motivations, and fit within Gymflow's remote culture.

6. Reference Checks: Successful candidates undergo reference checks to verify their previous performance and work ethic.

7. Offer & Onboarding: The chosen candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation and benefits. Upon acceptance, a comprehensive onboarding process begins, integrating the new specialist into the team and Gymflow's operations.

job_description:
AI Driven Engineer Ruby - CloudWalk

About CloudWalk

CloudWalk is a fintech company revolutionizing the payments industry. We are a team of passionate individuals driven by innovation and a commitment to building the future of payments.

What You'll Be Doing

As an AI Driven Engineer Ruby, you will play a key role in developing and maintaining backend applications for KYC processes and banking operations. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Developing and maintaining backend applications for KYC processes and banking operations.
  • Preparing and submitting regulatory reports to the Brazilian Central Bank (Bacen).
  • Developing and maintaining comprehensive automated test suites.
  • Debugging and resolving complex production issues.
  • Analyzing customer profiles for risk management and onboarding.
  • Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders and other engineering teams.
  • Mentoring and developing other engineers, contributing to team growth and technical excellence.

What You Need To Succeed

  • Proficiency in Ruby on Rails development.
  • Strong systems architecture and coding/scripting skills.
  • Experience with service-oriented architectures and complex distributed systems at scale.
  • Deep understanding of the Brazilian financial ecosystem and regulatory requirements.
  • Familiarity with event-driven architectures and messaging systems (Kafka).
  • Advanced English communication skills.

Join Our Journey

At CloudWalk, we believe in the power of AI to transform industries. We are looking for talented individuals who are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and making a real impact.

  • Develop and maintain backend applications: Focus on KYC processes and banking operations using Ruby on Rails.
  • Ensure regulatory compliance: Prepare and submit reports to the Brazilian Central Bank (Bacen) adhering to all relevant regulations.
  • Implement robust testing: Design, develop, and maintain comprehensive automated test suites to guarantee application quality.
  • Resolve production issues: Debug and troubleshoot complex production issues, ensuring system stability and uptime.
  • Analyze customer data: Leverage data analysis techniques to assess customer profiles for risk management and onboarding purposes.
  • Collaborate effectively: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders and other engineering teams, to deliver successful projects.
  • Foster team growth: Mentor and guide junior engineers, contributing to the team's technical expertise and development.

job_description:
Senior Security Engineer

About Immutable

Immutable is a global technology company valued at AUD $3.5 billion, powering the leading platform for building games on Ethereum. We are committed to building an inclusive, diverse workplace and offer a range of benefits to support our employees' growth and wellbeing.

Job Description

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Senior Security Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in securing our platform and protecting our users. You will own and operate our Security Operations (SecOps) and SOAR platforms, design and implement detection pipelines, and lead initiatives to harden our security posture.

Responsibilities:

  • Own and operate SecOps and SOAR platforms, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
  • Design and implement detection pipelines to surface high-fidelity security alerts.
  • Lead initiatives to harden endpoints, SaaS controls, and workforce identity systems.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, product, and operations teams to integrate security into the SDLC and product architecture.
  • Leverage AI, scripting, and automation to reduce toil and scale the security function.

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in detection and response engineering, security automation, or security operations.
  • Strong hands-on knowledge of cloud-native services (AWS/GCP), SOAR tools, endpoint agents, and identity protocols.
  • Experience building pipelines that ingest, enrich, and route data to security platforms.
  • Curiosity and passion for threat modelling, attack simulation, and adversary behavior.

Benefits:

  • Globally competitive salaries and contributions.
  • Employee Stock Options.
  • Flexible working model with a USD $500 WFH allowance and USD $600 per annum for internet and phone usage.
  • Up to USD $1,350 per annum for classes, courses, or events to support growth and development.
  • USD $800 per year for health and wellbeing expenses.
  • 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents, including an additional six weeks for rest and recovery.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Security Operations: Own and manage the Security Operations (SecOps) and Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) platforms, ensuring their effectiveness and efficiency.
  • Threat Detection & Response: Design, implement, and maintain detection pipelines to identify and surface high-fidelity security alerts, enabling timely and accurate threat response.
  • Security Hardening: Lead initiatives to strengthen security posture across various domains, including endpoints, Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) applications, and workforce identity systems.
  • Security Integration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate security considerations into the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and product architecture.
  • Automation & Efficiency: Leverage artificial intelligence (AI), scripting, and automation technologies to streamline security processes, reduce manual effort, and enhance the scalability of the security function.
about_company:

Driven by a mission to empower creators and players alike, Immutable fosters an inclusive and diverse workplace where innovation thrives. The company offers globally competitive salaries, employee stock options, and flexible working models to attract and retain top talent. Immutable is committed to building the future of gaming, one secure and innovative game at a time.

About Loancrate:

Loancrate is a fully remote company on a mission to automate mortgage workflows and empower lenders with AI-native tooling. Since 2020, we've enabled over $85 billion in new home loans, and we're aiming to save the industry $16 billion in operating expenses annually.

About the Role:

We're seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer to join our growing team and build the future of home buying in the US. You'll architect, build, and launch complex AI agents and job processing infrastructure on AWS, integrating with third-party lending services APIs to generate documents and prevent fraud.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and deploy scalable and robust AI-powered solutions on AWS.
  • Integrate with third-party lending services APIs to streamline workflows and enhance security.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative and impactful features.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of our software architecture and best practices.

Qualifications:

  • Hands-on experience with AWS services (ECS, RDS, ElastiCache, Kafka, ElasticSearch) and Terraform.
  • Familiarity with modern AI product development lifecycles and security considerations.
  • Strong understanding of software design principles and best practices.
  • Experience scaling high-throughput distributed systems in the cloud.
  • Proven ability to design and scale complex relational database schemas.

  • Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and make a real impact.
  • Collaborative and supportive remote work environment.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, design, data science) to define and implement innovative features.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of Loancrate's cloud infrastructure on AWS.
  • Write clean, well-documented, and testable code adhering to best practices and coding standards.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, ensuring system stability and performance.
  • Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends in AI and software development.

job_description:
Personalized Internet Assessor (Freelance)

About TELUS Digital AI Community

Join the TELUS Digital AI Community, a global network of over 1 million contributors, and help shape the future of search! We're a growing community dedicated to supporting machine learning models for top brands.

Job Description

As a Personalized Internet Assessor, you will play a crucial role in improving the user experience for millions of search engine users. You will analyze and provide feedback on a variety of content, including texts, pages, images, and other information, using an online tool. Your ratings and insights will help refine search results for relevance and quality.

Responsibilities:

  • Review and rate search results for accuracy, relevance, and overall quality.
  • Provide constructive feedback on content to enhance user experience.
  • Analyze and understand diverse content types, including text, images, and multimedia.

Qualifications:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
  • Strong understanding of current and historical US business, media, sports, news, social media, and cultural affairs.
  • Active user of Gmail, Google+, and other social media platforms.
  • Familiarity with web browsers and various content types.
  • Reliable access to broadband internet, a smartphone, and a personal computer.

Compensation:

  • Estimated hourly earnings: $14 USD per hour.

Additional Information:

  • No prior professional experience required.
  • Must pass a language assessment and open book qualification exam.
  • ID verification is required.
  • This is a part-time, long-term freelance project with standard quality assurance checks.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

As a Personalized Internet Assessor, you will:

  • Evaluate Search Results: Analyze and rate the relevance and quality of search results for a variety of queries using a provided online tool.
  • Provide Feedback: Offer detailed and constructive feedback on search results, including identifying areas for improvement and suggesting alternative content.
  • Contribute to User Experience: Your ratings and feedback will directly contribute to enhancing the search experience for millions of users.
  • Stay Updated: Maintain familiarity with current US trends and information across various domains, including business, media, sports, news, social media, and culture.
  • Adhere to Guidelines: Strictly follow provided guidelines and quality assurance standards to ensure accurate and consistent assessments.

As a community-driven platform, we foster collaboration and knowledge sharing, providing a dynamic environment for individuals to contribute to real-world AI advancements. By joining our community, you become part of a global network making a tangible impact on the future of technology.

We are seeking a motivated and results-driven Business Development Manager to join our growing team and expand our reach across new markets. This is a fantastic opportunity for a passionate individual to contribute to the success of a dynamic company in the exciting world of online marketing.

job_description:
Senior Developer - Revolutionize DeFi Trading

About Wintermute

Wintermute is building a decentralized trading platform poised to redefine the DeFi user experience.
