job_description:
Workday HR Systems Analyst

About MoonPay

MoonPay is a leading infrastructure company powering the future of Web3. We are a fast-growing, innovative team passionate about making crypto accessible to everyone.

About the Role

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Workday HR Systems Analyst to join our growing People Operations team. As a subject matter expert, you will be responsible for the day-to-day support, configuration, and optimization of our Workday HCM system. You will partner with cross-functional teams to understand their needs and deliver solutions that streamline HR processes and enhance the employee experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Act as the primary point of contact for Workday HCM support, resolving issues and providing guidance to users.
  • Lead Workday configuration updates, new module implementations, and integrations to support evolving business needs.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze system gaps, and recommend process improvements.
  • Analyze system data, generate reports, and provide insights to support key People programs.
  • Stay abreast of Workday best practices and industry trends.

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of hands-on Workday configuration experience with a strong understanding of multiple modules (e.g., Core HR, Benefits, Compensation).
  • Proven experience troubleshooting integrations with downstream systems.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on process optimization.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Passion for technology and a desire to learn and grow within the HR technology space.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and equity package
  • Unlimited holidays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Annual training budget
  • Home office setup allowance
  • Monthly budget to spend on MoonPay products
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for Workday HCM support, addressing day-to-day user inquiries and resolving technical issues.
  • Lead the configuration and implementation of new Workday modules and integrations, ensuring alignment with evolving business requirements.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and deliver tailored Workday solutions.
  • Identify system gaps and inefficiencies, propose process improvements, and implement solutions to enhance HR operational effectiveness.
  • Support key People programs by configuring Workday functionalities, analyzing data, generating reports, and troubleshooting system issues.
  • Stay abreast of Workday updates and best practices, proactively recommending and implementing enhancements to optimize system performance.

Driven by a passionate team of innovators, MoonPay is committed to building the infrastructure that will unlock the full potential of Web3. We believe in empowering individuals through financial freedom and fostering a more inclusive and accessible digital future.

job_description:
Information Security Officer

About Finoa

Finoa is a leading cryptocurrency management platform in Europe, with offices in Berlin and Porto. We offer a flexible working environment, access to cutting-edge technologies, and opportunities for professional development.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Information Security Officer (ISO) to join our growing team. The ISO will play a crucial role in developing and implementing our information security strategy, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our systems and data.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in developing and implementing information security policies, procedures, and standards.
  • Conduct risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and recommend mitigating controls.
  • Develop and deliver security awareness training programs for employees.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate security requirements into new projects.
  • Stay abreast of emerging threats and security technologies.
  • Participate in audits and compliance assessments.
  • Provide guidance and support to employees on security best practices.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Information Risk, or equivalent experience.
  • Strong understanding of information security principles, standards, and best practices.
  • Experience with security tools and technologies (AWS, EKS, WAF, MDM, SSO, etc.).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

job_description:
Software Engineer - Ledger IOE Cardano

About IOG

IO Global (IOG) is a technology company dedicated to advancing blockchain research and development, with a particular focus on the Cardano blockchain. We are a remote-friendly company committed to fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented and experienced Software Engineer to join our Ledger IOE Cardano team. In this role, you will contribute to the development and maintenance of critical components of the Cardano blockchain, ensuring its security, scalability, and performance.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and implement high-quality code for IOG's products, focusing on the Cardano blockchain.
  • Implement features such as protocol rules and transaction validation.
  • Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams across multiple time zones.
  • Review specifications, code, and pull requests to ensure code quality and adherence to best practices.
  • Debug and fix software issues, integrating software components seamlessly.
  • Create clear and concise documentation for developed code and features.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (preferred but not required).
  • Minimum 5 years of professional development experience in Haskell.
  • Strong understanding and experience with declarative programming paradigms.
  • Proficiency in Git, GitHub, and Nix (preferred).
  • Advanced knowledge of functional programming techniques, data structures, and serialization techniques.
  • Familiarity with testing frameworks, performance analysis, and low-level programming concepts.

Benefits:

IOG offers a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefits program, including laptop reimbursement, a new starter package, learning & development opportunities, and generous PTO.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain core Cardano blockchain components: Contribute to the development and maintenance of critical software modules within the Cardano ecosystem, including protocol rules, transaction validation logic, and consensus algorithms.
  • Implement new features and functionalities: Translate design specifications into functional code, implementing new features and functionalities that enhance the Cardano platform's capabilities.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work effectively within a distributed team environment, collaborating with engineers, researchers, and product managers across multiple time zones.
  • Ensure code quality and maintainability: Adhere to coding best practices, write clean and well-documented code, and participate in code reviews to ensure high code quality and maintainability.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues: Identify, diagnose, and resolve software defects and performance bottlenecks, contributing to the stability and reliability of the Cardano blockchain.
about_company:
About IOG

IO Global (IOG) is a leading technology company dedicated to advancing the frontiers of blockchain technology. Driven by a passion for innovation and a commitment to open-source development, IOG spearheads research and development for the Cardano blockchain, a groundbreaking, peer-reviewed, and sustainable platform for decentralized applications.

With a global team of talented engineers, researchers, and designers, IOG fosters a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diversity and excellence. As a remote-first company, IOG empowers its employees to work from anywhere in the world while maintaining a strong sense of community.

IOG is committed to building a future where blockchain technology empowers individuals, fosters transparency, and drives positive change across industries.
selection_process:

3. Video Interview: Candidates who successfully complete the technical assessment will participate in a video interview with the hiring manager and/or team members. This interview will focus on technical skills, experience, and cultural fit.

4. Coding Challenge: Top candidates will be invited to complete a coding challenge simulating real-world tasks related to the Cardano blockchain.

5. Final Interview: Finalists will participate in a final interview with senior leadership to discuss their technical expertise, career aspirations, and alignment with IOG's vision.

6. Offer & Onboarding: Successful candidates will receive a formal offer and undergo a comprehensive onboarding process.

About OneSignal

OneSignal is a leading omnichannel customer engagement solution, empowering businesses to deliver personalized customer journeys across mobile and web push notifications, in-app messaging, SMS, and email. Collaboration & Problem Solving:

Continuous Improvement:

Binkies is a thriving scale-up with a diverse, remote team of over 15 nationalities. We're passionate about bringing cutting-edge 3D visuals to life on client websites.

job_description:
English Language Data Annotator

About DataForce by TransPerfect

DataForce by TransPerfect is a leading provider of language and technology solutions, part of the world's largest language services company. With offices in over 100 cities worldwide, we empower businesses to connect with global audiences.

Job Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly motivated English Language Data Annotator to join our team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in improving the accuracy and performance of our language technologies by analyzing and labeling English data.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze English data to identify potential issues and inconsistencies.
  • Classify and label information according to specific guidelines.
  • Assist in project coordination, including scheduling, sourcing, testing, and management of transcript creation.
  • Meet daily Key Performance Indexes (KPIs) and ensure high-quality output.
  • Effectively communicate and collaborate with team members and supervisors.

Qualifications

  • Native or near-native fluency in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong reading comprehension and analytical abilities.
  • Meticulous attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
  • Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work independently.
  • Proficiency in using computers and relevant software applications.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Data Annotation: Accurately annotate English language data, including text and audio, according to project specifications. This involves tasks such as tagging entities, identifying sentiment, and transcribing speech.
  • Quality Assurance: Review and verify the quality of annotated data, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
  • Project Collaboration: Participate in project discussions, provide feedback, and collaborate with team members to ensure project success.
  • Performance Tracking: Monitor and maintain individual performance metrics, meeting established deadlines and quality standards.
  • Continuous Learning: Stay updated on industry best practices and advancements in data annotation techniques.
about_company:
About TransPerfect

TransPerfect is the world's largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business. With offices in over 100 cities worldwide, TransPerfect delivers a comprehensive suite of services, including translation, interpretation, localization, and technology solutions.

As part of the TransPerfect family, DataForce specializes in providing high-quality data annotation services to power the development of cutting-edge AI and machine learning applications. Senior System Software Engineer, Cloud Networking

About NVIDIA

NVIDIA is a leading technology company in the AI computing space, committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We offer a competitive compensation package and opportunities for professional growth.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior System Software Engineer to join our Cloud Networking team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, prototyping, and implementing programmable software-defined networking solutions for NVIDIA Virtualized Clouds.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, prototype, and implement programmable software-defined networking solutions for NVIDIA Virtualized Clouds.
  • Develop and maintain CI/CD environments for Cloud Software Defined Network (SDN) projects.
  • Collaborate with multiple teams to implement GitOps practices and automated tests.
  • Write and maintain automated tests (unit, integration, system) and support existing GitLab CI/CD pipelines.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Minimum 12 years of experience in designing and supporting complex CI/CD pipelines.
  • Advanced knowledge of networking, scripting, and "Infrastructure as Code" build and deployment tools.
  • Strong command of programming languages (C and Go) and deep knowledge of Kubernetes environments.
  • Practical experience with deploying and supporting CNIs.

Compensation:

  • Base salary range: $224,000 - $356,500 USD.
  • Eligible for equity and benefits.
  • Salary will be determined based on location, experience, and the pay of employees in similar positions.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and Implement SDN Solutions: Develop and implement programmable software-defined networking solutions for NVIDIA Virtualized Clouds, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
  • CI/CD Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) environments specifically for Cloud Software Defined Network (SDN) projects.
  • GitOps Implementation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate GitOps practices into the SDN development lifecycle, promoting automation and streamlined workflows.
  • Automated Testing: Write and maintain comprehensive automated tests (unit, integration, system) to ensure the quality and stability of SDN solutions.
  • Pipeline Support: Provide ongoing support and maintenance for existing GitLab CI/CD pipelines, resolving issues and implementing improvements.

About Highspot

Highspot is a leading sales enablement platform revolutionizing how businesses equip their sales teams for success. We are committed to building breakthrough software and fostering equitable workspaces.

Job Summary

As a Solutions Consultant, you will be the technical expert guiding revenue leaders in medium to large B2B companies through the value of Highspot's solutions. You will partner with sales teams, delivering compelling presentations, demonstrations, and workshops to drive opportunities forward.

Responsibilities

  • Explain Highspot's solutions and demonstrate their value to prospective clients.

  • Familiarity with CRM systems such as Salesforce and Microsoft Dynamics.
  • Strong business acumen and a passion for revenue generation.
  • Excellent communication, facilitation, and objection handling skills.

Compensation & Benefits

selection_process:
Tether Operations Limited - Print & Multimedia Designer Hiring Workflow

1. Application Review: Candidates submit resumes and portfolios through the job portal. The AI agent automatically screens applications based on keywords and experience, prioritizing those with relevant skills and years of experience.

2. Initial Screening: Shortlisted candidates are contacted for a brief phone interview conducted by a recruiter. This interview focuses on confirming basic qualifications and assessing communication skills.

3. Design Challenge: Selected candidates receive a design challenge tailored to Tether's brand and industry. This allows the team to evaluate their creative abilities, technical proficiency, and understanding of design principles.

4. Portfolio Review: Candidates submit their portfolios for in-depth review by the design team. This stage focuses on analyzing their design style, versatility, and ability to execute projects across various mediums.

5. Final Interview: Top candidates participate in a final interview with the hiring manager and design team. This discussion delves into their experience, design philosophy, and cultural fit within Tether's remote work environment.

job_description:
Senior Regulatory Specialist - DeepHealth (Remote)

About DeepHealth

DeepHealth is the AI division of RadNet, a leading provider of medical imaging services in the US. We develop and market cutting-edge AI-powered software solutions for cancer detection, improving patient outcomes and revolutionizing healthcare.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Regulatory Specialist to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring our AI-based medical devices comply with all relevant regulatory requirements. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, providing expert guidance on regulatory matters throughout the product development lifecycle.

Responsibilities

  • Provide regulatory input on design and development activities for AI-powered medical devices.
  • Ensure compliance with FDA Quality System Regulations, Medical Devices Regulations (MDR 2017/745), and other applicable regulations.
  • Assess documentation for medical device submissions and communicate regulatory guidance to internal teams.
  • Create and maintain technical documentation for regulatory approval and clearance.
  • Evaluate proposed design, labeling, and distribution changes for potential regulatory impact.
  • Oversee compliance with product post-marketing requirements.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., biology, engineering, regulatory affairs) or equivalent experience.
  • 6-8 years of experience in a regulated industry, preferably with a focus on FDA and Software as a Medical Device (SaMD) regulations.
  • Strong understanding of FDA Quality System Regulations and Medical Devices Regulations (MDR 2017/745).
  • Proven experience drafting and submitting regulatory filings, including 510(k) submissions.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
  • Dynamic and collaborative team environment.
  • Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development.
  • Fully remote working environment.

Visa Sponsorship

  • The company can only support visa sponsorship between European countries at this time.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Regulatory Strategy & Compliance: Develop and implement regulatory strategies for DeepHealth's AI-based software products, ensuring compliance with FDA regulations (including Quality System Regulations and Medical Devices Regulations) and other relevant international standards.
  • Product Development Guidance: Provide expert regulatory input throughout the product development lifecycle, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure designs, labeling, and documentation meet regulatory requirements.
  • Submission & Approval: Lead the preparation and submission of regulatory filings, including 510(k) applications, to obtain necessary approvals and clearances for DeepHealth products.
  • Documentation & Reporting: Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including risk management files, design history files, and other regulatory submissions.
  • Post-Market Surveillance: Oversee post-market surveillance activities to ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory requirements and address any identified issues.
  • Regulatory Intelligence: Stay abreast of evolving regulatory landscape and industry best practices, proactively identifying potential impacts on DeepHealth products and strategies.

Our team of experts combines deep expertise in medical imaging, artificial intelligence, and regulatory compliance to create innovative products that empower radiologists and clinicians. We are committed to fostering a dynamic and collaborative work environment that encourages continuous learning and innovation. about_company:
About Ibility

Ibility is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business and a Woman-Owned Small Business dedicated to providing exceptional support services to very low-income Veteran families. We are a growing company with a commitment to fostering a positive and collaborative work environment.

At Ibility, we believe in empowering our employees through a flexible hybrid work model, offering a balance of onsite travel and remote work opportunities. We are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision plans, unlimited paid time off, and a 401k plan.

Ibility is driven by a passion for making a difference in the lives of Veterans and their families. We strive to deliver high-quality services that empower individuals and strengthen communities.
selection_process:
Ibility Hiring Workflow for Internal Controls Specialist

1. Application Review: AI-powered screening analyzes resumes for required skills and experience.

2. Phone Screening: HR conducts brief calls to assess communication skills and initial fit.

3. Skills Assessment: Candidates complete a technical assessment testing Excel proficiency and analytical abilities.

4. Video Interview: A structured interview with hiring managers evaluates experience, problem-solving, and cultural alignment.

5. Reference Checks: Verifying past performance and professional conduct through references.

6. Final Interview: A panel interview with key stakeholders to delve deeper into qualifications and discuss expectations.

7. Decision & Offer: The hiring team makes a final decision and extends a competitive offer to the selected candidate.

8. Onboarding: New hire completes necessary paperwork, receives orientation, and begins their journey with Ibility.
